Author: TheAllMightiest
Text: [https://www.eatingdisorderfoundation.org/learn-more/about-eating-disorders/](https://www.eatingdisorderfoundation.org/learn-more/about-eating-disorders/)  >Anorexia subtypes: "A person with restricting type of AN does not engage in binge/purge behaviors.  Their weight loss is from severe restriction.  The binge-eating/purging type of AN involves recurrent episodes of binge eating and/or purging behavior (self-induced vomiting, misuse of diuretics, compulsive exercise laxatives, or enemas)"  It sounds like your behavior falls in line with the binge-purge subtype of anorexia; you restrict, binge, purge (starving yourself and progressing towards the urge to self-induce vomiting), and repeat the cycle.  Telling your parents was the right first step! I hope they take you seriously. At 15 you can really damage your body, hormone levels, and growth development. Early intervention while you're young and early into this can really help you prevent this from turning into a life-long issue. You would really benefit from a therapist that specializes in eating disorders.
